{{ddcl|header=cwctype|
std::wctype_t wctype( const char* str );
}}

Constructs a value of type {{c|std::wctype_t}} that describes a {{lc|LC_CTYPE}} category of wide character classification. It may be one of the standard classification categories, or a locale-specific category, such as {{tt|"jkanji"}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|C string holding the name of the desired category}}
{{par end}}

The following values of {{c|str}} are supported in all C locales:
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|value of {{tt|str}}|effect}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"alnum"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswalnum}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"alpha"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswalpha}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"blank"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswblank}} {{mark c++11}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"cntrl"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswcntrl}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"digit"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswdigit}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"graph"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswgraph}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"lower"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswlower}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"print"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswprint}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"space"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswspace}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"upper"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswupper}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|"xdigit"}}|identifies the category used by {{lc|std::iswxdigit}}}}
{{dsc end}}

===Return value===
{{c|std::wctype_t}} object suitable for use with {{lc|std::iswctype}} to classify wide characters according to the named category of the current C locale or zero if {{c|str}} does not name a category supported by the current C locale.
